articles.headline: To Protect an Ancient City, China Moves to Raze It
articles.snippet: Saying it fears earthquake damage, the government plans to demolish and rebuild 85 percent of Kashgar’s Old City.
articles.abstract: Saying it fears earthquake damage, the government plans to demolish and rebuild 85 percent of Kashgar’s Old City.
articles.lead_paragraph: KASHGAR, China  A thousand years ago, the northern and southern branches of the Silk Road converged at this oasis town near the western edge of the Taklamakan Desert. Traders from Delhi and Samarkand, wearied by frigid treks through the world’s most daunting mountain ranges, unloaded their pack horses here and sold saffron and lutes along the city’s cramped streets. Chinese traders, their camels laden with silk and porcelain, did the same.

articles.headline: Music Labels Cut Friendlier Deals With Start-Ups
articles.snippet: The changes stem from an unavoidable reality facing the music business: the economics of offering music free on the Web do not work.
articles.abstract: The changes stem from an unavoidable reality facing the music business: the economics of offering music free on the Web do not work.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  With CD sales dropping fast, it is not hard to imagine how the major music labels could benefit from the growth of Web start-ups like Imeem. The company’s service lets people listen to songs, discover new artists and share their favorites with friends. And in return, Imeem owes the labels licensing fees for use of the music.

articles.headline: Don’t Quit That Kindle Just Yet
articles.snippet: One step beyond the Kindle, the new, smaller Cool-er book reader has a removable battery, and one charge is good for 8,000 page turns. What could be wrong?
articles.abstract: One step beyond the Kindle, the new, smaller Cool-er book reader has a removable battery, and one charge is good for 8,000 page turns. What could be wrong?
articles.lead_paragraph: So often in life, reality doesn’t live up to the marketing; the fine print gets you every time. Vacation resort brochures always show the beaches and pools gleaming, well-lighted and completely empty. Movie trailers harvest 45 seconds of hilarity from even the biggest duds. And as for online dating profiles  well, you know.

articles.headline: China Is Said to Plan Strict Gas Mileage Rules
articles.snippet: New Chinese fuel economy rules would be even more stringent than the United States standards that President Obama is seeking to impose.
articles.abstract: New Chinese fuel economy rules would be even more stringent than the United States standards that President Obama is seeking to impose.
articles.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG  Worried about heavy reliance on imported oil, Chinese officials have drafted automotive fuel economy standards that are even more stringent than those outlined by President Obama last week, Chinese experts with a detailed knowledge of the plans said on Wednesday.

articles.headline: On Sotomayor, Some Abortion Rights Backers Are Uneasy
articles.snippet: Some abortion-rights leaders are expressing unease that Judge Sonia Sotomayor might not be a reliable vote to uphold Roe v. Wade if she is approved for the Supreme Court.
articles.abstract: Some abortion-rights leaders are expressing unease that Judge Sonia Sotomayor might not be a reliable vote to uphold Roe v. Wade if she is approved for the Supreme Court.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  In nearly 11 years as a federal appeals court judge, President Obama’s choice for the Supreme Court, Sonia Sotomayor, has never directly ruled on whether the Constitution protects a woman’s right to an abortion. But when she has written opinions that touched tangentially on abortion disputes, she has reached outcomes in some cases that were favorable to abortion opponents.

articles.headline: Toys ‘R’ Us Makes Deal for F.A.O. Schwarz
articles.snippet: The retailing chain says it will keep the name and hands-on shopping experience of F.A.O. Schwarz, an iconic New York store.
articles.abstract: The retailing chain says it will keep the name and hands-on shopping experience of F.A.O. Schwarz, an iconic New York store.
articles.lead_paragraph: Toys “R” Us announced early Thursday that it had bought F. A. O. Schwarz, one of the oldest toy retailers in the nation and a staple on Fifth Avenue, where the flagship store is guarded by rosy-cheeked toy soldiers.

articles.headline: Chrysler Cures a Bankruptcy, but Tests Loom
articles.snippet: Chrysler will have some benefits with its new partner, Fiat, but it will be competing in a brutal marketplace.
articles.abstract: Chrysler will have some benefits with its new partner, Fiat, but it will be competing in a brutal marketplace.
articles.lead_paragraph: When President Obama announced the government’s reorganization plan for Chrysler in late April, he promised the bankruptcy would be “quick,” “efficient,” and “controlled.”

articles.headline: Sotomayor Pick a Product of Lessons From Past Battles
articles.snippet: The White House’s Supreme Court selection plan had been months in the works, involving veterans determined to avoid the pitfalls of the past.
articles.abstract: The White House’s Supreme Court selection plan had been months in the works, involving veterans determined to avoid the pitfalls of the past.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  President Obama’s aides were laying down the law. They had invited liberal activists to the White House two weeks ago to discuss his coming Supreme Court selection, but they were not asking for candidates.
articles.byline: By Peter Baker and Adam Nagourney

articles.headline: Hedge Fund Is Dissolving as It Faces 2nd Inquiry
articles.snippet: Pequot Capital Management, a $3 billion investment firm, is closing because an investigation into insider trading at the fund is heating up once again.
articles.abstract: Pequot Capital Management, a $3 billion investment firm, is closing because an investigation into insider trading at the fund is heating up once again.
articles.lead_paragraph: In the rarefied world of hedge funds, he is one of the greats  a stock-picker who managed to make money, bull market or bear, for more than two decades.

articles.headline: Bush v. Gore Foes Join to Fight Gay Marriage Ban
articles.snippet: David Boies and Theodore B. Olson, opposing lawyers in the 2000 recount, have teamed up to fight Proposition 8 in California, citing equal protection and due process.
articles.abstract: David Boies and Theodore B. Olson, opposing lawyers in the 2000 recount, have teamed up to fight Proposition 8 in California, citing equal protection and due process.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  The David and Ted show is back in business.

articles.headline: G.M. Plan Gets Support From Key Bondholders
articles.snippet: G.M. said a key group of bondholders agreed to a 10 percent stake, with warrants to buy an additional 15 percent, in exchange for accepting the bankruptcy plan.
articles.abstract: G.M. said a key group of bondholders agreed to a 10 percent stake, with warrants to buy an additional 15 percent, in exchange for accepting the bankruptcy plan.
articles.lead_paragraph: DETROIT  As General Motors moved closer to a bankruptcy filing, possibly early next week, attention on Thursday turned again to the bondholders, the most important group that the company has yet to win over for its efforts to start fresh.
articles.byline: By Michael J. de la Merced and Micheline Maynard
